summary: The document is a classified FBI record from the JFK Assassination Records Collection, focusing on intelligence activities and reports about Cuban exile groups in Miami during the 1970s. It details the operations of a Soviet agent, Miguel KASSEL, including his interactions with Cuban exiles and communications with Soviet contacts. The document also covers the dissolution of the Partido Revolucionario del Pueblo (PRP) and the emergence of the Movimiento Independente Radical de Cuba (MIRC), a group with ambitions to overthrow Castro. Concerns regarding terrorism, particularly plans to target Cuban embassies and Soviet Bloc missions in Latin America, are highlighted. Additionally, it reflects the U.S. government's position of not backing Cuban exile groups, emphasizing its focus on maintaining relations with the USSR over taking action against Cuba.
key_findings: The document reveals the activities of a Soviet agent, Miguel KASSEL, in Miami, including his contacts with Cuban exile groups and his reports to Soviet contacts.
It discusses the disintegration of the Partido Revolucionario del Pueblo (PRP) and the formation of a new movement, Movimiento Independente Radical de Cuba (MIRC), aimed at overthrowing Castro.
The document highlights concerns about terrorism, including plans to attack Cuban embassies and Soviet Bloc missions in Latin America.
It notes the U.S. government's stance of not supporting Cuban exile groups and its prioritization of relations with the USSR over actions against Cuba.
